children.text: The slab has been fully checked in all areas, and we can confirm that there are no visible areas where the slab steel is exposed outside of the slab edges/surfaces, indicating that the correct clearances have been maintained during the slab pour.
It is a requirement of section 5.3.2 Reinforcement of AS 2870 Residential Slabs and Footings, that
‘Reinforcement in rafts and slabs shall be placed with minimum concrete cover of the reinforcement shall be 40 mm to unprotected ground and 40 mm to external exposure’ .
This item is to confirm that the slab steel appears to have been properly placed, and there is no action required from the builder at this stage in relation to this issue.
